definition: branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc

sentences.english: SGP reached out to stakeholders and common participants.
sentences.chinese: SGP向利益相关者和普通参与者抛出了橄榄枝。

sentences.english: It was China Mobile that first offered the olive branch to Apple.
sentences.chinese: 中国移动第一个向苹果伸出橄榄枝。

sentences.english: Think of it as an olive branch filled with yuanleaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它想象成一枝结满人民币的橄榄枝。

sentences.english: Both products are also courting the large PHP market.
sentences.chinese: 这两个产品也都向庞大的PHP市场伸出了橄榄枝。

sentences.english: Use the olive-branch icon to find low-fat garden fare.
sentences.chinese: 根据橄榄枝的图标寻找低脂田园菜肴。

definition: to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
to poach (talent, personnel from competitors)/to raid (a competitor for its talent)/Taiwan pr. [wa1 jiao3]
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
